Lakeland College Admission Requirements

APPLICATION STEPS

  • Choose a program click here
  • Check out the costs
  • Apply online to start up an online page visit here
  • Email your transcripts and other documents
  • To download MADI (My Alberta Digital ID), here

Application Processes for Lakeland College Admission Requirements

To apply through Alberta, follow the 6 given steps for a successful application:

  • Create a secure login Account here
  • Find your Alberta Student Number (ASN)
  • Authorize Transcript Transfer
  • Fill in profile
  • Complete the Application at the Institution of Choice
  • forward Application and Pay every Application fees

Personal information includes:

  • Your full legal name; please include your middle name
  • Your date of birth
  • Your mailing address and other contact information
  • Your citizenship

Academic information includes:

  • Your high school (s) transcripts you have attained
  • Post-secondary institutions you attained
  • High school courses

About high school courses:

You may need to list the course required for the program you are applying to take. Check the Courses to Declare by Program e-document.

English Language Proficiency Requirements

  • TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language): minimum of 78 on the internet-based test (iBT) exam and a minimum score of 19 in each of the four tested areas.
  • IELTS (International English Language Testing System): A minimum grade score of 6.0 in general, with at least 6.0 on each band score on the academic test.
  • CAEL (Canadian Assessment of English Language): a maximum grade score of 60 in general, with at least 55 on each band score, is required for admission to Lakeland.
  • MET (Michigan English Test): A minimum score of 58 on all bands.
  • Duolingo: a maximum score of 100 with at least 95 on each subscore.
  • PTE- A (Pearson Test of English, Academic): Lakeland College requires a PTE academic score of 53 with no communication skills lower than 50.
